thinking.disposable_income: High disposable income with median household income of $121,562 and 58.8% of households making over $100,000. This suggests residents can generally absorb higher transportation costs and taxes
thinking.discretionary_consumption: High discretionary spending capacity given the affluent population. The 1.5% tax would impact larger purchases but is manageable for most residents given their income levels
thinking.accessibility: Excellent multi-modal accessibility with 45.6% no-car households, high transit usage (18.9%), and significant walk/bike share (27.6%). Area has good transit infrastructure and walkability
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritized policies that improve transit times while maintaining reasonable fares given high transit usage. 2. Higher driving fees acceptable as most residents can afford it and it will reduce congestion. 3. Higher tax rates viable given high incomes. 4. Balanced approach favoring proposals that improve both transit and driving times. 5. Selected policies that encourage sustainable transportation while maintaining service quality
